headline: Florida's Department of Education asked textbook publishers to avoid references to critical race theory and social justice
author: Yelena Dzhanova
sentences: "Examples of theories that distort historical events and are inconsistent with State Board approved standards include the denial or minimization of the Holocaust, and the teaching of Critical Race Theory, meaning the theory that racism is not merely the product of prejudice, but that racism is embedded in American society and its legal systems in order to uphold the supremacy of white persons," the amendment reads in part.

"Critical Race Theory, Social Justice, Culturally Responsive Teaching, Social and Emotional Learning, and any other unsolicited theories that may lead to student indoctrination are prohibited," according to the guidance.

A wave of Republican lawmakers all around the nation have sought to limit the teachings of critical race theory, an academic framework that examines how race and racism have interacted with American law.
DeSantis in December celebrated the bill as the "strongest legislation of its kind in the nation" and saying it "will take on both corporate wokeness and Critical Race Theory."
The agency released guidance asking publishers to avoid adding content that attempts to "indoctrinate or persuade students to a viewpoint inconsistent with Florida standards."

In June, Florida's State Board of Education passed an amendment that banned the teaching of critical race theory, claiming the framework can "distort historical events."
Florida's Department of Education is urging textbook publishers to avoid references to critical race theory and social justice in future editions, Politico reported.
The bill, called the Stop the Wrongs to Our Kids and Employees Act, or Stop WOKE Act, bars discussions around certain topics pertaining to race.
